Package org.github.terminological.jepidemic.estimate

Class CoriEstimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.github.terminological.jepidemic.estimate.CoriEstimator

  • public class CoriEstimator
extends Object
    An estimator of the reproduction number (\(R_t\)) using a renewal equation method. The renewal equation method depends on a time series of infections, and on the infectivity profile - a measure of the probability that a secondary infection occurred on a specific day after the primary case, given a secondary infection occurred. A Bayesian framework is then used to update a prior probabilistic estimate of \(R_t\) on any given day with both information gained from the time series of infections in the epidemic to date and the infectivity profile to produce a posterior estimate of \(R_t\). This is based on the article:

    A. Cori, N. M. Ferguson, C. Fraser, and S. Cauchemez, ‘A New Framework and Software to Estimate Time-Varying Reproduction Numbers During Epidemics’, Am J Epidemiol, vol. 178, no. 9, pp. 1505–1512, Nov. 2013, doi: 10.1093/aje/kwt133.

    and the implementation of it in the R Library EpiEstim. It assumes that infections (or other type of observation) are a Poisson distributed process and that the reproduction number is a gamma distributed quantity. The estimates of \(R_t\) may be aggregated over a specific "window" to provide a more stable estimate.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CoriEstimator​(double r0Mean, double r0SD, int maxWindow)
      The Estimator is configured with the baseline \(R_0\) assumptions which are used as prior values for \(R_t\) when no other values are available, or the withDefaultPrior() option is used.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoriEstimator

        public CoriEstimator​(double r0Mean,
                     double r0SD,
                     int maxWindow)
        The Estimator is configured with the baseline \(R_0\) assumptions which are used as prior values for \(R_t\) when no other values are available, or the withDefaultPrior() option is used.
        Parameters:
        r0Mean - - The mean of the gamma distribution of the baseline prior assumption about R0 - the theorerical reproduction number in an infinite pool of evenly mixing susceptible individuals
        r0SD - - The SD of the prior gamma distribution
        maxWindow - - The maximum sliding window over which to estimate \(R_t\).

        Parameters:
        on - - a boolean flag to switch on (TRUE) or off (FALSE) eipestim naming convention
        Returns:
        the estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • defaultEpiEstim

        public static CoriEstimator defaultEpiEstim​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumericVector infectivityProfile,
                                            double meanR0,
                                            double sdR0,
                                            int window)
        Produces a CoriEstimator that is configured to behave like the default settings of EpiEstim. In that it uses a fixed prior for Rt and returns a fixed window size

        Parameters:
        infectivityProfile - - a vector with the discrete probability distribution of the serial interval with \(P_{(t=0)} = 0\)
        meanR0 - - the mean prior of R0
        sdR0 - - the sd prior of R0
        window - - the window size
        Returns:
        a default cori estimator

      • defaultUncertainEpiEstim

        public static CoriEstimator defaultUncertainEpiEstim​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumericArray infectivityProfiles,
                                                     double meanR0,
                                                     double sdR0,
                                                     int window,
                                                     int n2)
        Produces a CoriEstimator that is configured to behave like the default settings of EpiEstim. In that it uses a fixed prior for Rt and returns a fixed window size and aggregates uncertain SI distributions with a random resampling strategy

        Parameters:
        infectivityProfiles - - a numeric matrix with the discrete probability distribution of the serial interval with \(P_{(t=0)} = 0\)
        meanR0 - - the mean prior of R0
        sdR0 - - the sd prior of R0
        window - - the window size
        n2 - - the number of samples to use for estimating confidence limits on bootstrapped infectivity profiles
        Returns:
        a default cori estimator

      • selectSpecificWindow

        public CoriEstimator selectSpecificWindow​(int window)
        The select methods define how the posterior estimate of \(R_t\) is selected. In this case a set value for the window is used. This must be less or equal to the value of maxWindow supplied in the CoriEstimator::new constructor. The window defines how many data points prior to the time of the estimate are used to synthesise the posterior estimate of \(R_t\), and so tends to reduce the uncertainty around the value of \(R_t\), but longer values of window introduces temporal uncertainty into the estimates. This is as implemented in EpiEstim (with a default value of 7 for the window).
        Parameters:
        window - - a number of days
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • selectAll

        public CoriEstimator selectAll​()

      • selectAdaptiveWindow

        public CoriEstimator selectAdaptiveWindow​(double incidenceSum,
                                          int minWindow)
        The adaptive windowing strategy selects a posterior estimate of \(R_t\) by selecting the shortest window length (> minWindow) which spans at least incidenceSum infection (or observation) counts. This ensures that where numbers are low the estimation window is lengthened (up ot the value of maxWindow provided to the CoriEstimator::new constructor) to include more data at the cost of temporal precision. This prevents stochastic noise from dominating the estimates of \(R_t\).
        Parameters:
        incidenceSum - - the number of cases that must be observed in a window. It there are fewer that this the window will be lengthened. Larger values lead to smoother estiamtes at the cost of reduced temporal precision.
        minWindow - - the minimum size of the window that will be selected. In times of very high case numbers a minimum window prevents spurious outliers from completely dominating that days estimate of \(R_t\).
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • selectMinimumUncertainty

        public CoriEstimator selectMinimumUncertainty​(double timeVsRt,
                                              int minWindow)
        The minimum uncertainty strategy aims to select a window for the posterior \(R_t\) estimate based on minimising a combined value for uncertainty. The uncertainty in this case is the product of the (timeVsRt)th root of SD of the posterior estimate and the window size to the power of timeVsRt.

        $$window^{timeVsRt} * SD_{posterior}^\frac{1}{timeVsRt}$$
        Parameters:
        timeVsRt - - the relative importance parameter. Values above one favour temporal certainty; values under one favour \(R_t\) estimate certainty
        minWindow - - the minimum size of the window that will be selected.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • selectMixtureCombination

        public CoriEstimator selectMixtureCombination​()
        The mixture combination strategy for selecting a posterior \(R_t\) involves finding all the estimates that have a window that is centred on the estimate date (this may involve longer windowed estimate from dates in the future) and estimating a gamma distribution with the same mean and SD as the mixture of all the estimates. This combined estimate involves estimates of all different windows.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • selectWeightedMixtureCombination

        public CoriEstimator selectWeightedMixtureCombination​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumericVector weights)
        The mixture combination strategy for selecting a posterior \(R_t\) involves finding all the estimates that have a window that is centred on the estimate date (this may involve longer windowed estimate from dates in the future) and estimating a gamma distribution with the same mean and SD as the mixture of all the estimates. This combined estimate involves estimates of all different windows.
        Parameters:
        weights - - the weighting of the different windows as a vector which much be the same length as the longest window, maxTau.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • withDefaultPrior

        public CoriEstimator withDefaultPrior​()
        This sets the selection strategy for prior estimate of the reproduction number to be the fixed R0 value provided to the CoriEstimator::new constructor. All estimates use the same prior and this is equivalent to the strategy implemented in EpiEstim (which has a default value of 5 for the mean and 5 for the SD of the R0 prior). This is an uninformed prior strategy.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • withFixedPrior

        public CoriEstimator withFixedPrior​(double mean,
                                    double sd)
        This sets the selection strategy for prior estimate of the reproduction number to be fixed value. All estimates use the same value as an uninformed prior, but enables us to compare the impact of different priors.
        Parameters:
        mean - - the mean of the fixed prior \(R_t\)
        sd - - the sd of the fixed prior \(R_t\)
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • withAdaptivePrior

        public CoriEstimator withAdaptivePrior​(double factor)
        This sets the prior to be the posterior for the previous timestep, but with the SD of the previous posterior widened to allow the equivalent of a random walk. The widening factor defines how much change we expect to see in each time step
        Parameters:
        factor - - must be above 1 (or else the estimate will become locked on a specific value)
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • collectResampledQuantiles

        public CoriEstimator collectResampledQuantiles​(int sampleSize)
        This configures how the estimator combines multiple estimates of \(R_t\) using different infectivity profiles. In this case the estimator will randomly sample from the selected posterior gamma distribution produced for each infectivity profile. These samples are combined and a mean, sd and empirical quantiles calculated.
        Parameters:
        sampleSize - - the number of samples to draw for each posterior estimate of \(R_t\). This number will be multiplied by the number of infectivity profile estimates and the number time points, so should not be set too high or it will lead to memory consumption issues. This is the equivalent of the $n2$ parameter in EpiEstim
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • collectMixtureQuantiles

        public CoriEstimator collectMixtureQuantiles​()
        This configures how the estimator combines multiple estimates of \(R_t\) using different infectivity profiles. In this case it calculates a mixture distribution of all the posterior estimates, and combined values for mean, and standard deviation, of the mixture plus the quantiles using a brent solver.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • collectMixtureApproximation

        public CoriEstimator collectMixtureApproximation​()
        This configures how the estimator combines multiple estimates of \(R_t\) using different infectivity profiles. In this case it calculates a mixture distribution of all the posterior estimates, and then estimates a single gamma distribution with the same mean and SD as the mixture. This will only be a valid approximation if all the posterior estimates are close to each other, which will be the case if the infectivitiy profiles are fairly similar. It shoudl tend to produce estimates with less confidence. It is however the quickest method.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • detailedOutput

        public CoriEstimator detailedOutput​()
        Configure the estimator to output full details for all infectivity profiles.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • withInfectivityProfile

        public CoriEstimator withInfectivityProfile​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumericVector infectivityProfile,
                                            boolean replace)
        Configure the estimator with an infectivity profile. At least one profile must be added
        Parameters:
        infectivityProfile - - A numeric vector of the daily discrete probability of a secondary infection event occurring given an infected individual. It is assumed that this vector starts at time zero with a probability of zero.
        replace - - replace the existing infectivity profile with this new one? if false then the profile is added to a list.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • withInfectivityProfileMatrix

        public CoriEstimator withInfectivityProfileMatrix​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumericArray infectivityProfiles)
        Configure the estimator with an infectivity profile by specifying it as a matrix. This will replace all previously set profiles.
        Parameters:
        infectivityProfiles - - A numeric array of the daily discrete probability of a secondary infection event occurring given an infected individual. It is assumed that this vector starts at time zero with a probability of zero.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • atStartOfTimeseries

        public CoriEstimator atStartOfTimeseries​()
        If the timeseries is at the start then we can safely impute zero values prior to the start of the timeseries. If the timeseries starts in the middle of the epidemic we must infer the infections prior to the beginning of the time series if we are to prevent sudden jumps in the estimates over the initial part of the timeseries.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • inMiddleOfTimeseries

        public CoriEstimator inMiddleOfTimeseries​()
        If the timeseries starts in the middle of the epidemic we must infer the infections prior to the beginning of the time series if we are to prevent sudden jumps in the estimates over the initial part of the timeseries. This is done using the supplied value of R0 to infer a growth rate.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • estimateRt

        public uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe estimateRt​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe incidence,
                                                              String dateColName,
                                                              String incidenceColName)
        Estimates \(R_t\) for a one or more timeseries of infections in an epidemic, where the supplied dataframe is grouped
        Parameters:
        incidence - - a dataframe containing at least 2 columns (one containing a date, the other a numeric count of cases). The dataframe may be grouped, in which case grouping is preserved, and each group is treated as a seperate time series
        dateColName - - the name of the date column
        incidenceColName - - the name of the incidence column
        Returns:
        a dataframe, containing either a summary of the estimates of \(R_t\) with mean, sd, and quantiles for each day, or a full breakdown of the component \(R_t\) estimates.

      • estimateRtSingle

        public uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe estimateRtSingle​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe incidence,
                                                                    String dateColName,
                                                                    String incidenceColName)
                                                             throws IncompleteTimeseriesException
        Estimates \(R_t\) for a single timeseries of infections in an epidemic.
        Parameters:
        incidence - - a dataframe containing at least 2 columns (one containing a date, the other a numeric count of cases). The dataframe may be grouped, in which case grouping is preserved
        dateColName - - the name of the date column
        incidenceColName - - the name of the incidence column
        Returns:
        a dataframe, containing either a summary of the estimates of \(R_t\) with mean, sd, and quantiles for each day, or a full breakdown of the component \(R_t\) estimates.
        Throws:
        IncompleteTimeseriesException - if the timeseries does not have contiguous dates

      • estimateRtSingle

        public CoriEstimationResult estimateRtSingle​(CoriTimeseries rtSeries)
                                      throws IncompleteTimeseriesException
        This converts the input timeseries into a EstimateResult time series. This is the native Java methd in the api.
        Parameters:
        rtSeries - - a CoriTimeseries
        Returns:
        a CoriEstimateResult.
        Throws:
        IncompleteTimeseriesException - if the timeseries does not have contiguous dates

      • estimateRtFromRates

        public uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe estimateRtFromRates​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe rates,
                                                                       String dateColName,
                                                                       String rateColName,
                                                                       int samplesPerProfile)
        Estimates \(R_t\) for a one or more timeseries of infections in an epidemic, where the supplied dataframe is grouped
        Parameters:
        rates - - a dataframe containing at least 2 columns (one containing a date, the other a numeric poission rate of cases). The dataframe may be grouped, in which case grouping is preserved, and each group is treated as a seperate time series
        dateColName - - the name of the date column
        rateColName - - the name of the rate column
        samplesPerProfile - - the number of times to bootstrap per infectivity profile
        Returns:
        a dataframe, containing either a summary of the estimates of \(R_t\) with mean, sd, and quantiles for each day, or a full breakdown of the component \(R_t\) estimates.

      • estimateRtFromSingleRate

        public uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe estimateRtFromSingleRate​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe rate,
                                                                            String dateColName,
                                                                            String rateColName,
                                                                            int samplesPerProfile)
                                                                     throws IncompleteTimeseriesException
        Estimates \(R_t\) for a single timeseries of infections in an epidemic.
        Parameters:
        rate - - a dataframe containing at least 2 columns (one containing a date, the other a numeric estimate of possion rate of cases). The dataframe may be grouped, in which case grouping is preserved
        dateColName - - the name of the date column
        rateColName - - the name of the estimated poisson rate
        samplesPerProfile - - the number of times to bootstrap per infectivity profile
        Returns:
        a dataframe, containing either a summary of the estimates of \(R_t\) with mean, sd, and quantiles for each day, or a full breakdown of the component \(R_t\) estimates.
        Throws:
        IncompleteTimeseriesException - if the timeseries does not have contiguous dates
